body:
[PREVIOUS LIST](https://ruqq.us/3yd0)

* Add a badge for GMs that own a guild in the top 100, exclude users that are not the primary GM (the one who owns the guild).

* When you click on the guild leave button it should ask are you sure, this will stop users accidentally leaving.

* Show somewhere on the guild page how long you have been a member there.

* On my own profile page if I hover over my rep I should get a breakdown of how many up and down votes I’ve received.

* Shadow edit posts (don’t say edited if it was changed within 10mins of post creation), maybe even titles? Implement it in the same way as GitHub. 

* Post yanking should send a request to the OP so they can accept or decline. 

* If a user has blocked my account let us see the post or comment but not reply or vote, this can already be bypassed by opening the thread in incognito so I’m just asking that I not have to click as much. 

* Let us upvote posts/ comments directly on a user profile.

* Clicking a link in a post should open it a new tab automatically.

* Commenting @GM will notify the guild masters of the guild you are in, useful for making them aware and asking for a comment to be pinned.
body_html:
PREVIOUS LIST

  • Add a badge for GMs that own a guild in the top 100, exclude users that are not the primary GM (the one who owns the guild).

  • When you click on the guild leave button it should ask are you sure, this will stop users accidentally leaving.

  • Show somewhere on the guild page how long you have been a member there.

  • On my own profile page if I hover over my rep I should get a breakdown of how many up and down votes I’ve received.

  • Shadow edit posts (don’t say edited if it was changed within 10mins of post creation), maybe even titles? Implement it in the same way as GitHub.

  • Post yanking should send a request to the OP so they can accept or decline.

  • If a user has blocked my account let us see the post or comment but not reply or vote, this can already be bypassed by opening the thread in incognito so I’m just asking that I not have to click as much.

  • Let us upvote posts/ comments directly on a user profile.

  • Clicking a link in a post should open it a new tab automatically.

  • Commenting @GM will notify the guild masters of the guild you are in, useful for making them aware and asking for a comment to be pinned.
title: Another list of ideas

body:
Yeah, I don't know either. You could still do the same without replying to their comments. For example, I can make comments like this under posts where milkit has commented: "milkit is a powermod!" or "milkit sucks" (Note that milkit hasn't blocked me, and while I think he's a powermod, I don't hate him. I'm using him as an example)

I guess these types of comments would probably get more attention if they were made directly under a post/comment made by the user they're describing though.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Yeah, I don't know either. You could still do the same without replying to their comments. For example, I can make comments like this under posts where milkit has commented: "milkit is a powermod!" or "milkit sucks" (Note that milkit hasn't blocked me, and while I think he's a powermod, I don't hate him. I'm using him as an example)

I guess these types of comments would probably get more attention if they were made directly under a post/comment made by the user they're describing though.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

author.bio: gone in search of free speech and nicer community
author.bio_html: gone in search of free speech and nicer community

body:
> Shadow edit posts

Wouldn't it just be much better to be able to view post/comment editing history? Have an option to see all versions of the submission with timestamps.

> Post yanking

IMO this is not a good idea. There are two problems:

* People often won't approve yanking not because they don't want their post to be yanked, but because they can't be bothered (no real incentive for them to allow it) or maybe because they aren't online.

* Anyone can just copypaste your post into their guild. The yank feature just makes this easier.

I think what might be worth discussing is adding an opt-in setting along the lines of "don't allow yanking of my posts" or "ask me before allowing a yank". But still I don't think it matters too much for the reasons mentioned.

> user has blocked my account

Absolutely. I would maybe even go as far as to say that a blocked person should still be able to vote and comment on your content and the only effect blocking should have is you not seeing it (not getting notifications, their content not showing or showing collapsed).

I agree with the rest.
body_html:
Shadow edit posts

Wouldn't it just be much better to be able to view post/comment editing history? Have an option to see all versions of the submission with timestamps.

Post yanking

IMO this is not a good idea. There are two problems:

  • People often won't approve yanking not because they don't want their post to be yanked, but because they can't be bothered (no real incentive for them to allow it) or maybe because they aren't online.

  • Anyone can just copypaste your post into their guild. The yank feature just makes this easier.

I think what might be worth discussing is adding an opt-in setting along the lines of "don't allow yanking of my posts" or "ask me before allowing a yank". But still I don't think it matters too much for the reasons mentioned.

user has blocked my account

Absolutely. I would maybe even go as far as to say that a blocked person should still be able to vote and comment on your content and the only effect blocking should have is you not seeing it (not getting notifications, their content not showing or showing collapsed).

I agree with the rest.

This used to be a place to share, view, and track feedback for Ruqqus. Now it's pretty useless because the admins don't care. Try buttering them up on discord. They don't respond here.

post.body:
[PREVIOUS LIST](https://ruqq.us/3yd0)

* Add a badge for GMs that own a guild in the top 100, exclude users that are not the primary GM (the one who owns the guild).

* When you click on the guild leave button it should ask are you sure, this will stop users accidentally leaving.

* Show somewhere on the guild page how long you have been a member there.

* On my own profile page if I hover over my rep I should get a breakdown of how many up and down votes I’ve received.

* Shadow edit posts (don’t say edited if it was changed within 10mins of post creation), maybe even titles? Implement it in the same way as GitHub. 

* Post yanking should send a request to the OP so they can accept or decline. 

* If a user has blocked my account let us see the post or comment but not reply or vote, this can already be bypassed by opening the thread in incognito so I’m just asking that I not have to click as much. 

* Let us upvote posts/ comments directly on a user profile.

* Clicking a link in a post should open it a new tab automatically.

* Commenting @GM will notify the guild masters of the guild you are in, useful for making them aware and asking for a comment to be pinned.
post.body_html:
PREVIOUS LIST

  • Add a badge for GMs that own a guild in the top 100, exclude users that are not the primary GM (the one who owns the guild).

  • When you click on the guild leave button it should ask are you sure, this will stop users accidentally leaving.

  • Show somewhere on the guild page how long you have been a member there.

  • On my own profile page if I hover over my rep I should get a breakdown of how many up and down votes I’ve received.

  • Shadow edit posts (don’t say edited if it was changed within 10mins of post creation), maybe even titles? Implement it in the same way as GitHub.

  • Post yanking should send a request to the OP so they can accept or decline.

  • If a user has blocked my account let us see the post or comment but not reply or vote, this can already be bypassed by opening the thread in incognito so I’m just asking that I not have to click as much.

  • Let us upvote posts/ comments directly on a user profile.

  • Clicking a link in a post should open it a new tab automatically.

  • Commenting @GM will notify the guild masters of the guild you are in, useful for making them aware and asking for a comment to be pinned.
post.title: Another list of ideas

body: Thanks for replying and finding an issue with my post yanking idea, the idea of disabling yanking will fix the issue other users are having as my solution is flawed. Maybe users could move their posts from general to a guild without a GM needing to yank manually.

parent.body:
> Shadow edit posts

Wouldn't it just be much better to be able to view post/comment editing history? Have an option to see all versions of the submission with timestamps.

> Post yanking

IMO this is not a good idea. There are two problems:

* People often won't approve yanking not because they don't want their post to be yanked, but because they can't be bothered (no real incentive for them to allow it) or maybe because they aren't online.

* Anyone can just copypaste your post into their guild. The yank feature just makes this easier.

I think what might be worth discussing is adding an opt-in setting along the lines of "don't allow yanking of my posts" or "ask me before allowing a yank". But still I don't think it matters too much for the reasons mentioned.

> user has blocked my account

Absolutely. I would maybe even go as far as to say that a blocked person should still be able to vote and comment on your content and the only effect blocking should have is you not seeing it (not getting notifications, their content not showing or showing collapsed).

I agree with the rest.

Shadow edit posts

Wouldn't it just be much better to be able to view post/comment editing history? Have an option to see all versions of the submission with timestamps.

Post yanking

IMO this is not a good idea. There are two problems:

  • People often won't approve yanking not because they don't want their post to be yanked, but because they can't be bothered (no real incentive for them to allow it) or maybe because they aren't online.

  • Anyone can just copypaste your post into their guild. The yank feature just makes this easier.

I think what might be worth discussing is adding an opt-in setting along the lines of "don't allow yanking of my posts" or "ask me before allowing a yank". But still I don't think it matters too much for the reasons mentioned.

user has blocked my account

Absolutely. I would maybe even go as far as to say that a blocked person should still be able to vote and comment on your content and the only effect blocking should have is you not seeing it (not getting notifications, their content not showing or showing collapsed).

I agree with the rest.

body:
> SO. I assume you mean whoever is the Top GM of a Top 100 guild would earn the badge? Would they still have the badge if they stopped qualifying?

I don't think admins have ever removed badges except the patreon badge which has become unobtainable, maybe you could lose it if you fall out of the top 100, perhaps that should be limited to top 10 so its even more rare.

> Nah. People were able to do that, once upon a time. Its only use was to mass dump votes on someone's rep. 

Thats why I said "Let us upvote", keep the downvote button disabled.

> 👍 Or at least be a user setting.

That and turning off infinite scroll should be a user setting, not every likes these. Thanks for your response :)
body_html:
SO. I assume you mean whoever is the Top GM of a Top 100 guild would earn the badge? Would they still have the badge if they stopped qualifying?

I don't think admins have ever removed badges except the patreon badge which has become unobtainable, maybe you could lose it if you fall out of the top 100, perhaps that should be limited to top 10 so its even more rare.

Nah. People were able to do that, once upon a time. Its only use was to mass dump votes on someone's rep.

Thats why I said "Let us upvote", keep the downvote button disabled.

👍 Or at least be a user setting.

That and turning off infinite scroll should be a user setting, not every likes these. Thanks for your response :)
